intro: Dicoryphe, commonly known as the water lily, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Nymphaeaceae. These plants are characterized by their floating leaves and showy, waterborne flowers that open during the day. Dicoryphe species typically have broad, rounded leaves that provide a habitat for various aquatic organisms. Their flowers are usually pink or white, with a distinctive structure that facilitates pollination by insects. The genus is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments.
